note: The total fertility rate is the number of children born to a woman if she lived to the end of her childbearing years and gave birth to children at the current age-specific fertility rates.
title: Countries with fertility rates above or below replacement level
subtitle: Fertility rates measure the average number of live births per woman. The "replacement level" is the rate at which population size remains constant from generation to generation; this is crudely defined as 2.1 births per woman.
